intro: Hieracium praecurrens subsp. platyrhombum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring dark green, broadly ovate leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive involucral bract. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
